newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico, Venuzuela reaffirm San Jose oil pact.
newsitem.headline: Mexico, Venuzuela reaffirm San Jose oil pact.

text.p: Mexico and Venezuela have reaffirmed their support for the so-called San Jose oil accord with Central American and Caribbean nations, Mexico's Ministry of Energy said on Sunday.
Venezuelan President Rafael Caldera was in Mexico last week for talks with his counterpart Mexican President Ernesto Zedillo.

Under the Program for Energy Co-operation with Central American and Caribbean Countries (San Jose accord), Mexico and Venezuela can offer 160,000 barrels a day of crude oil and derivatives as well as financing for development projects.
The accord was renewed in August.
The two large oil producers also decided to strengthen their co-operation in commercial exchanges and investments tied to energy projects, the Ministry said in a statement.
